1. Reduce caffeine intake: Caffeine can increase anxiety and nervousness. So, try to limit or eliminate caffeinated beverages like coffee, tea, soda, and energy drinks.

2. Increase omega-3 fatty acids: Omega-3 fatty acids can help to reduce anxiety symptoms by regulating neurotransmitters. Incorporate fatty fishes, such as salmon or mackerel, into your diet or consider taking omega-3 supplements.

3. Eat a balanced diet: Incorporate whole foods into your diet, such as whole grains, fruits, vegetables, lean protein, and healthy fats. These can help stabilize blood sugar and prevent mood swings.

4. Limit sugar and processed foods: High sugar foods and processed foods can destabilize blood sugar levels and contribute to anxiety symptoms.

5. Stay hydrated: Dehydration can cause fatigue, irritability, and mood swings. Drinking enough water can help prevent these symptoms.

6. Reduce alcohol consumption: Alcohol can cause dehydration and can lead to feelings of anxiety and depression.

7. Increase magnesium intake: Magnesium has been shown to help reduce anxiety by relaxing the nervous system. Foods high in magnesium include almonds, spinach, and avocados.

8. Avoid allergens and food sensitivities: If you have food allergies or sensitivities, avoiding them can help reduce symptoms of anxiety and stress.
